verses.verse: Then answered<WH6030> Zophar<WH6691> the Naamathite<WH5284>, and said<WH559>,
Should not the multitude<WH7230> of words<WH1697> be answered<WH6030>? and should a man<WH376> full of talk<WH8193> be justified<WH6663>?
Should thy lies<WH907> make<WH2790> men<WH4962> hold their peace<WH2790>? and when thou mockest<WH3932>, shall no man make thee ashamed<WH3637>?
For thou hast said<WH559>, My doctrine<WH3948> is pure<WH2134>, and I am clean<WH1249> in thine eyes<WH5869>.
But<WH199> oh that<WH5414> God<WH433> would speak<WH1696>, and open<WH6605> his lips<WH8193> against thee;

And that he would shew<WH5046> thee the secrets<WH8587> of wisdom<WH2451>, that they are double<WH3718> to that which is<WH8454>! Know<WH3045> therefore that God<WH433> exacteth<WH5382> of thee less than thine iniquity<WH5771> deserveth.
Canst thou by searching<WH2714> find out<WH4672> God<WH433>? canst thou find<WH4672> out the Almighty<WH7706> unto perfection<WH8503>?
It is as high<WH1363> as heaven<WH8064>; what canst thou do<WH6466>? deeper<WH6013> than hell<WH7585>; what canst thou know<WH3045>?
The measure<WH4055> thereof is longer<WH752> than the earth<WH776>, and broader<WH7342> than the sea<WH3220>.
If he cut off<WH2498>, and shut up<WH5462>, or gather together<WH6950>, then who can hinder<WH7725> him?
For he knoweth<WH3045> vain<WH7723> men<WH4962>: he seeth<WH7200> wickedness<WH205> also; will he not then consider<WH995> it?
For vain<WH5014> man<WH376> would be wise<WH3823>, though man<WH120> be born<WH3205> like a wild ass's<WH6501> colt<WH5895>.
If thou prepare<WH3559> thine heart<WH3820>, and stretch<WH6566> out thine hands<WH3709> toward him;
If iniquity<WH205> be in thine hand<WH3027>, put it far away<WH7368>, and let not wickedness<WH5766> dwell<WH7931> in thy tabernacles<WH168>.
For then shalt thou lift up<WH5375> thy face<WH6440> without spot<WH3971>; yea, thou shalt be stedfast<WH3332>, and shalt not fear<WH3372>:
Because thou shalt forget<WH7911> thy misery<WH5999>, and remember<WH2142> it as waters<WH4325> that pass away<WH5674>:
And thine age<WH2465> shall be clearer<WH6965> than the noonday<WH6672>; thou shalt shine forth<WH5774>, thou shalt be as the morning<WH1242>.
And thou shalt be secure<WH982>, because there is<WH3426> hope<WH8615>; yea, thou shalt dig<WH2658> about thee, and thou shalt take thy rest<WH7901> in safety<WH983>.
Also thou shalt lie down<WH7257>, and none shall make thee afraid<WH2729>; yea, many<WH7227> shall make suit<WH2470> unto thee<WH6440>.
But the eyes<WH5869> of the wicked<WH7563> shall fail<WH3615>, and they shall not escape<WH6><WH4498>, and their hope<WH8615> shall be as the giving up<WH4646> of the ghost<WH5315>.
